intro: Syrmatium nanum, commonly known as the dwarf syrmatium, is a small flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
